str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
From dietes; a space of two years.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Genitive Feminine Singular
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
Of Latin origin; happy; Phelix, a Roman.
A successor. From diadechomai; a successor in office.
Porcius, the middle (gentile) name of the procurator Festus. Of Latin origin; apparently swinish; Porcius, a Roman.
Festus. Of Latin derivation; festal; Phestus, a Roman.
And, both. A primary particle of connection or addition; both or also.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

word: to do the Jews a favor,
str2: From kata and tithemi; to place down, i.e. Deposit.
Of Latin origin; happy; Phelix, a Roman.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and leipo; to leave down, i.e. Behind; by implication, to abandon, have remaining.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.
